comments.text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (X11; Linux i686; rv:7.0.1) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/7.0.1
Build ID: 20110928224103

Steps to reproduce:

I added default account settings into some js file in prefs folder.  Among other lines there were:
pref("mail.server.server1.authMethod", 5);
pref("mail.smtpserver.smtp1.authMethod", 5);
pref("mail.server.server1.login_at_startup", true);

Or using autoconfig system:
pref("general.config.filename", "thunderbird.cfg");
And thunderbird.cfg:
defaultPref("mail.server.server1.authMethod", 5);
defaultPref("mail.smtpserver.smtp1.authMethod", 5);
defaultPref("mail.server.server1.login_at_startup", true);


Actual results:

When I tried to change these settings via GUI  - changes were not saved. After some investigation I understood the next things:
I'm not able to change login_at_startup option.
I'm not able to change imap (not smtp) authMethod only, and to "Normal password" only.
Smtp authmethod changes normally. And I can change imap authmethod to any value (e.g. NTLM) except "Normal password".
If authMethod is not "3" then this bug occurs.
If I set pref("mail.server.default.authMethod", 5); - bug occurs too.
I'm able to change any of these values via about:config - all settings are saved normally.
This bug occurs in Windows and Linux.



Expected results:

GUI changes should have been saved.

comments.text:
(In reply to Ludovic Hirlimann [:Usul] from comment #1)
> Any errors in Tools -> Error console ?
Nothing.
> 
> >If authMethod is not "3" then this bug occurs.
> 
> Which one , it seems you have more than one here.
any of:
mail.server.default.authMethod
mail.server.server1.authMethod
> 
> Do you have the proper rights on the js file ?
user's prefs.js? writable. System js/cfg file is readable.
> 
> Does it work if you don't use the MDC/autoconfiguration ?
Yes it works.
And now I see that it works if I change value of mail.server.default.authMethod to any non-default(3) via about:config, I can set mail.server.server1.authMethod to "3" via GUI. The same for mail.server.*.login_at_startup. If I change server.default... to non-default via about:config, all works fine.
> 
> Do you distribute extension with Thunderbird ?
All extensions,languagepacks and plugins are disabled.
